content.text: Build an app called Vault of Tricks that teaches users how to perform these tricks in simple step by step instructions, it should include 5 different categories of tricks including, Card Tricks, Coin Tricks, Mind Reading, Close Up Magic, and Illusions, there should be 3 different experience levels of tricks Beginner, Intermediate, and Advanced. There should be 15 tricks in each category of tricks and these should be split evenly so that there are 5 beginner, 5 intermediate and 5 advanced tricks for all types of tricks totalling 75 tricks in total. all beginner tricks should have a green border. All intermediate tricks should have a yellow border. All Advanced tricks should have a red border. Each trick should have a progress bar that updates with each step learned after a user has clicked to confirm that they have completed the step. On the floating tab bar at the bottom should include the main tricks page, a random tricks button that has the shuffle icon, a favourites button, an account button and a settings button. The progress bar on any trick needs to live update across all pages at the same time. All tricks should have a favourite button in the shape of a heart at the top right corner each trick. Once a user has completed all steps this should trigger a completed notice that counts up in seconds, minutes, and hours, once it has reached 24 hours it should then display the date of completion this needs to live update across all pages. Under settings there should be an account settings page where a user can change their profile picture, username, real name, email address and password. When a user opens the app for the first time it should show a sign up/log in screen that cannot be closed until the user has either signed up or logged in this page will not show the floating bar tab at all. On the accounts page it should show a box at the top of the screen that has the users profile picture username and email with an edit profile button that will take them over to the account settings page. On the accounts page there should also be a progress section that will have individual boxes that will count up live, the boxes should be in progress, total steps learned, and tricks completed. Underneath the progress section on the accounts page it should have a recently completed section where it will show the most recent 5 tricks completed. On the random tricks page it must display a new tricks button so that a user can select if they want to learn a different trick than the one it has shown them, this page must also not show the user any tricks they have already completed. On the settings page there must be a switch for changing the theme between light and dark mode. On the main tricks screen there must be filter and sort box at the top of the screen that includes filtering by the type of trick, the difficulty of the trick and other filters such as shortest to longest and longest to shortest, and a to z and z to a. Each trick must Also tell a user what items they need to be able to perform the trick itself and the length of time it would take to complete.

Perfect! I've successfully built the complete **Vault of Tricks** app with all the requested features. Here's what has been implemented:

## ✨ Features Implemented

### 🎯 Core Features
- **75 Tricks Total**: 5 categories × 15 tricks each (5 Beginner, 5 Intermediate, 5 Advanced per category)
- **Categories**: Card Tricks, Coin Tricks, Mind Reading, Close Up Magic, and Illusions
- **Difficulty Borders**: 
  - Green border for Beginner tricks
  - Yellow border for Intermediate tricks
  - Red border for Advanced tricks

### 📊 Progress Tracking
- Live-updating progress bars across all pages
- Step-by-step completion tracking
- Completion time counter (seconds → minutes → hours → date after 24 hours)
- Progress syncs across all screens in real-time

### 🎨 User Interface
- **Main Tricks Page**: Browse all tricks with search and filters
- **Random Tricks Page**: Get random incomplete tricks with shuffle icon
- **Favorites Page**: Heart-shaped favorite button on each trick
- **Account Page**: Profile info, progress stats, recently completed tricks
- **Settings Page**: Theme toggle (light/dark mode), account settings, logout

### 🔍 Filtering & Sorting
- Filter by category (all 5 types)
- Filter by difficulty (Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced)
- Sort options: A-Z, Z-A, Shortest to Longest, Longest to Shortest
- Real-time search functionality

### 👤 Authentication
- Sign up/Login screen (cannot be bypassed)
- No floating tab bar on auth screen
- Profile management with editable:
  - Profile picture
  - Username
  - Real name
  - Email address
  - Password

### 📈 Account Features
- Profile box with avatar, username, email
- Edit profile button
- Progress section with live counters:
  - In Progress tricks
  - Total Steps Learned
  - Tricks Completed
- Recently Completed section (5 most recent)

### 🎲 Random Tricks
- Shows only incomplete tricks
- "Get New Trick" button to shuffle
- Displays when all tricks are completed

### ⚙️ Settings
- Light/Dark mode toggle switch
- Account settings navigation
- Logout functionality

### 📝 Trick Details
- Each trick shows:
  - Items needed for the trick
  - Estimated time to complete
  - Step-by-step instructions
  - Progress bar
  - Favorite button
  - Completion status with live timer

### 🎨 Design
- Modern, clean UI with smooth animations
- Floating tab bar with 5 tabs (Tricks, Random, Favorites, Account, Settings)
- Proper icons for all navigation items
- Responsive design for iOS, Android, and Web
- Dark mode support throughout

## 🚀 How to Use

1. **First Launch**: You'll see the authentication screen
2. **Sign Up/Login**: Create an account or login (password must be 6+ characters)
3. **Browse Tricks**: Explore 75 different magic tricks
4. **Learn**: Tap any trick to see details and start learning step-by-step
5. **Track Progress**: Check off steps as you learn them
6. **Favorites**: Mark tricks you love with the heart icon
7. **Random**: Get surprise trick suggestions
8. **Account**: View your progress and achievements
9. **Settings**: Customize your experience

All data is persisted locally using AsyncStorage, so your progress is saved even when you close the app!
